  • Constructor Details

    • Facility

      public Facility()
      The Facility class that has to have an organizer associated when we instantiate it, otherwise it is a floating facility. This description means that nobody else can create a similar facility (use case when we ban a facility). Facilities must also have the ability to have an event associated with them when one is created. This is handled by the controller.
      Since:
      2024-11-04

    • Facility

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the facility
      address - the address of the facility
      description - the description of the facility
      organizer - the organizer of the facility

    • saveFacilityProfile

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> saveFacilityProfile()
      Saves the facility profile to Firestore.
      Returns:
      a Task representing the save operation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if facility ID is null or empty

    • deleteFacility

      public void deleteFacility()
      Deletes the facility by setting its organizer to null, allowing administrators to disassociate the organizer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if facility name is invalid

    • associateEvent

      public void associateEvent(String eventID, boolean genEvent)
      Associates an event with a facility, creating the facility document if it doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      eventID - the event ID to associate

    • hasEvent

      public boolean hasEvent(String eventName)
      Checks if an event is already associated with the facility.
      Parameters:
      eventName - the event name to check
      Returns:
      true if the event is already associated, otherwise false
